title: Do you guys know current lethality scale/ratios ect.?

replies.body:
I wasn't able to get directly in touch with the devs at this moment, but I *was* able to find this on the League Wiki about lethality ratios:

Flat Armor Penetration = LETHALITY × (0.6 + 0.4 × Target's level ÷ 18)

i have one more question, the upcoming lethality buff is going to make it based of user lvl correct, also tell poppa fat raccoon hes great <3
{{item:3632}}  {{item:3513}}
I do know that the current PBE patch notes state that lethality will be based off the user's level, but always keep in mind those PBE patch notes are subject to last minute changes!
Stop kidding yourself, it isn't a buff. Lethality is garbage and so are the items.

If you refer to the gentleman's above equation, you'll see that you deal only a percentage of your lethality up front (60%) and gain the rest over the course of the game.

So if you had 10 lethality (and no other sources of armor penetration) and you were attacking a target who was level 1, you'd ignore 6.02 flat armor. Essentially, the higher level your opponent is, the more of their armor you ignore. Riot implemented this because flat armor penetration was too strong at the early phases of the game. Enjoy the fun facts, RedLink!
